column4: I did something really weird, and I don't know how I did it.  I was trying to alt-tab between windows but mashed some keys and my file menu tore away from my application.  Then I tried to emulate the same smashing of keys and the file menu want back to the application but it's not at the very top.  Anyone know how to fix this?
err... can you post a screenshot?
oh right... it's an application. I thought the gnome-panel
of course, you've tried dragging, right clock on  the menu's
yeah I've tried middle button dragging ctrl dragging everything pretty much
oh, nevermind, misunderstood. Did you enable detachable menu's in System->Prefernces->Menu's and toolbars?

probably, PenguinTV stores it's data in ~/.penguintv/ or the like. Perhaps if you delete that directory the UI will be restored. However, all your data for PenguinTV  will be removed too. Try making a backup of that directory, and then removing it alltogether (last resort :))
want to see what it looks like with the File menu torn off just for kicks?
what application was it that you mentioned which enables such behaviour?
what do you mean?  So far it's only done it with PenguinTV
nope it's unchecked.  I fixed it though finally, I just kept selecting different menus and smashing alt tab and space and it went back
err... very odd heh. I hope it's a 'feature' from Penguin TV!
yeah, seems like it only happens with PenguinTV.  I tried doing it with filezilla and firefox and got nothing
